tweets.text:
Received an #ICA21 rejection today and decided to create a #CVofFailures. Looking at the different rejections over the years next to my real CV reminded me that:

1) I put myself out there
2) The worst that can happen is "no"
3) Yes is the more frequent answer
4) Keep striving

Academia - like Hollywood - is a business of rejection. One difference: Hollywood doesn‚Äôt rub it in with unproductive, sanctimonious reviews. One similarly: Everyone‚Äôs best work at some point gets rejected. #highered #ica21 https://t.co/ugzgXHANgY

tweets.text: It's a virtual conference now! So we will miss Denver and Colorado this timeüòêI still remember a splendid AOIR 2013 conference there (best conference trip ever). However, very happy to share that our paper got accepted for #ica21 (with @ninafabiolas, @Maurerpt and @manuela_hinzüéâ

My paper (originally thesis) "Assessing political news quality: An automated comparison of political news quality indicators across German newspapers" got accepted to #ica21. Feels kinda surreal, having started my PhD largely from home and all, but exciting nonetheless!ü•≥

Huge thanks to @jpcrowls for his help!!

tweets.text: Be sure to check ScholarOne for your #ica21 reviews. They are due on Monday November 30 at noon Eastern time. Thank you! https://t.co/NnlTef1MlT

ICA member @annie_waldherr posted gratitude for her #ica14 Seattle mug, wistfully remembering conferences past. Now that we have some "space" from conferencing, unofficial poll: how do you feel about year-specific conference keepsakes? #ica21 @icahdq
I just reviewed THE BEST paper for @icahdq 2021. I hope it gets accepted so I can fangirl with the author.

One of my favorite coffee mugs these days.
